Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2010 09:42AM eastender wrote: Cindy, Your words are absolutely incredible.  Although I have finished radiation December 11, 2009 my flashbacks are so real and painful and I heal everydays.  You have a wonderful way of telling the personal 9/11.  Thank you!  This for my is healing.
Posts.Title: "its not good news" littlebird75 badger

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2009 02:18PM eastender wrote: Hi there, I have the same situation and thoughts...we are never cured, we are just in remission.  I have been expected just a wake up every morning and life is back to normal, however, that is not the case - we just have to work thru our emotions, I am starting counseling to see if there are any "tricks" to all of this.  I will keep you posted.  You are not alone! -- Eastender
Posts.Title: THE REALITY OF IT ALL Shanagirl Pure

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2009 01:07AM - edited Jul 13, 2009 01:10AM by eastender Hello there, I started my 1st chemo on July 2nd.  The first day after chemo I was wound pretty tight, I felt as though I could run a marathon..you just have to make yourself rest, take a long hot shower and get into your fav pjs.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee
